page.title: 08Whitfield Mineral Works
page.content: Whitfield Mineral Works near Kingsley is situated off the A52, down a little track. It used to be a brickworks with a chimney 50 feet high. Now they make fireclay aggregate which is exported to Norway, Portugal, Saudi Arabia and Australia. This is the process they use: the clay is brought in by wagons from Leicester, Shropshire and Scotland and stored in a large pile. A digger tips clay into a hopper. It passes under a massive iron drum which crushes it as fine as flour. Coke and water are added and it is baked at 1700F. It becomes fused into blocks. These are sprayed with water to cool them. They are ground again and put into bags. Certain grades may also be used as a binding agent in animal feed pellets. Twelve men and one woman work there now.
